name: Warriors
description:
Strength and Honor
Warrior cultures are martial societies shaped by conflict and struggle. They value strength, courage, and proving oneself through combat or challenge. Every scar tells a story, and a warrior's reputation is their most valuable possession.

culturalRestrictions.name: Honor-Bound
culturalRestrictions.description: A warrior is bound to their honor and does not use poisons, traps or attacking from stealth while in combat. If the warrior employs any of these methods, they lose 1 resolve.

culturalRestrictions.name: Debt of Blood
culturalRestrictions.description: When you or an ally is brought to 0 health by a creature, you make a vow of blood against the creature that did it. Until this creature is defeated or brought to justice, you lose 1 resolve every day. If you become broken as a result of this loss, the vow ends.

benefits.name: Tests of Mettle
benefits.description: When engaged in an honorable contest such as a competition, trial or duel, you gain a bonus dice to all physique and finesse checks.

benefits.name: Badge of Honor
benefits.description: You start with one cosmetic injury. For each cosmetic injury that you have obtained by rolling a lifeline check, your maximum morale is increased by 1.

startingItems.name: Honor Blade
startingItems.description: A dagger that is used to grant a humanoid or beast an honorable death if they have surrendered or can no longer fight back. If this blade is used dishonorably, the wielder loses 1 resolve.

startingItems.name: Tribal Emblem
startingItems.description: An emblem affixed to a piece of equipment that identifies you as a member of a group of warriors. Other warriors in this group will take this as an indisputible sign that you belong to that group.

startingItems.name: Woad Kit
startingItems.description: A kit that allows the warrior to paint their face and body before an important battle. When painted in this way, the warrior recovers 3 resolve after their next battle if it contained a champion or higher tiered creature. The woad wears off after a full rest, causing the warrior to lose 3 resolve if they did not fight a battle with a champion tiered creature or higher.
